bow: need some advice about my overweight toddler mommitors assemble please help my and half year old daughter is extremely overweight ve tried everything in my power to help her lose the weight but she does seem to be getting any smaller some back story when she was born she was only which told is on the small side she had few months where she would only fall asleep if was in the bed with her feeding her bottle and it usually took few small bottles to get her to sleep indulged her because was sleep deprived myself and had pretty severe case of the baby blues fully aware that was the right thing to do but hindsight is always 20 20 stopped over feeding her as soon as realized how bad it got we ve had genetic tests thyroid tests and such and everything was negative ve tried feeding her less feeding her medium sized meals day with no snacks feeding her small meals day feeding her meals that always followed pattern fruit for breakfast fruit and veggie for lunch protein and veggie for dinner and more other ways than can list she only drinks skim milk crystal light or water everything she eats is low fat fat free sugar free or low calorie though we occasionally give her piece of chocolate or cookie when she had bad day she plays outside every day and does physical therapy for something unrelated so she gets plenty of exercise out of ideas and worried for my daughters health sorry for the wall of text just at my wits end and would be extremely appreciative of any input you moms may have wow thank you for all the advice did expect nearly this much do have time to respond to everyone right now but know how helpful all of you have been my advice is to cut out the crystal light and sugar free foods the fake sugar is so great for her digestive system and actually make you crave more sugar its great that you have acknowledged problem and are doing something about it now thanks mom is your doctor concerned and have you spoken with him or her how much does she weigh and how tall is she is her pediatrician concerned had no idea she drinks about cups of the crystal light day so that alone may have obvious results just feel so guilty that let it get so bad they do exactly have diets for year olds so sort of winging it thank you for the input what have the doctors recommended are they giving you guidance help it sounds like you re on top of things but think you need external help that nothing to be ashamed of here picture of her to give you better idea of how big she is http imgur com fhx4ut0 jpg about year and half ago her doctor put her on strict diet of 24 to 28 ounces of formula day did that for months and it did help so he said again that she needed to lose weight and when asked him how he just said feed her less even though been feeding her exactly what he said to switched doctors and got her tested for all sorts of things but they did explain anything and the doctor didnt really have anything else to offer should mention she on medicaid and we have to go to doctor that approved her plan so there may be an issue of quality of service with her pediatrician it been while since her last visit but remember she was in the 90th percentile for height so she on the tall side her weight was 36 pounds at her last visit posted picture of her in the comments if that helps think it at the bottom right now what does typical menu like how often does she snack on what does your family have history of obesity or obesity related illness what is her sleep like how is her insulin does she make too much if the doctors have checked that yet they should that could be an issue sugar free and fat free stuff is really all that healthy as it just makes up for taste in other areas suggest cutting all if not most processed foods skim milk can actually be worse than regular milk if remember correctly there may be more sugar in skim not sure google it maybe if she refuses to drink regular water what you can do is find juice that has no sugar added and water it down so it is lightly sweet the fruit sugar is better than added table sugar in germany they suggest this for diabetics and people with insulin issues lastly has she been tested for allergies like know my friend has gluten allergy and when she gave it up she started dropping weight rather rapidly another friend also has son that is rather large for his age he doctors can not figure out why are you also able to qualify for early headstart they may be able to help would also recommend talking with your county health services there is probably home health nurse or another program that might be able to help you out see where you feel guilty hey it happens but the fact that you care and are trying to make healthy changes speaks volumes here problem see you do want to make her smaller your goal should be to slow down her weight gain until it evens out with her height give it plenty of time you can chart her on the growth chart occasionally to see if her bmi percentile is improving you need to look into her serving sizes for child of her age and how much of each food group she needs feel her meal pattern is very limited only fruit for breakfast you are giving her carbs but nothing with protein to help sustain and even out that rise in blood sugars this can easily lead to her feeling hungry very soon after fruit and veggie for lunch same thing add little protein here keep in mind there is such thing as eating too little it fine line but not eating enough will cause her body to hold onto everything she eats limit her milk intake to meal times maybe oz servings water the rest of the day if she wants flavor try infusing the water with fresh fruits snacks can be fruits and veggies not too restrictive on fat free sugar free things but they do say that they can cause you to crave even more sweet stuff the fact that her doctor tried limiting her formula worries me infants should never never be put on diet also the fact that the doctor wants her lost weight also worries me not fan of this doctor give your little girl time to adjust to healthy eating give her body time to change and do expect her to lose weight this should be process not fad diet for child source registered dietitian would give her super watered down apple juice every few days as her special drink even though it has calories it is much healthier also fruit is high in natural sugars stick more to veggies at this age would panic as long as you set her up with healthu eating habits the rest will work itself out she may not lose weight but get taller so it is more evenly distributed instead of focusing on sugar free and fat free foods try cutting out carbs salt and red meats would also only give her water and milk lead by example if you eat healthy she will catch on too please go see nutritionist for her sugar free fat free foods are the enemy they are packed full of chemicals that leave you wanting more would cut out the crystal light and only off water or milk it life style change not diet you have to change everything an stick with it kids loose weight mostly by growing but would def seek professional for help red meats for god sake why agree with cutting down on the carbs especially processed carbs but there is nothing wrong with red meat also fat is not bad in fact you have to watch all those reduced fat and fat free foods because in lot of cases they make up for the lost flavor from fat by adding sugar fat in your diet has nutritional benefits and will also make you feel full more quickly as many people here have already said avoid sugars drop the crystal light in favor of water and keep giving her healthy choices like veggies fruits but not too much and lean meats if your doctor is making light of her weight issues by saying milk than or whole milk more calories the higher the fat percentage though agree with you and many other posters cut the processed foods and anything with added sugar do eliminate but take it easy on the carbs fruits grains heavy on the veg proteins healthy fats also did care for that doctor she has problem with choking and he would even order swallow study at my request her new doctor is more greasy overall assuming this is why sw33tleafxx suggested cutting them chicken fish and eggs are good choices for protein she should be eating mostly nutrient rich vegetables try scrambled eggs in the morning straight up no cheese no ketchup etc would definitely follow the advice from the dietician you could also try to get her more physically active when my daughter was to would take her walking running with me several times week she would get worn out at first but after couple of months would want to go for miles she is now and is my running buddy it true that processed carbs are the best but it not wise to put growing child on carb free diet we do gluten free at my house have celiacs and we do lot of corn and rice pasta which is great if it is unreasonable to see dietician not nutritionist because they are unregulated then try these steps increase her lean protein intake eggs meat that is not deep fried and not processed have protein at every meal and snack increase her fiber intake whole grains steel cut oatmeal at breakfast no white bread no processed cereals etc cut out all sugar free light fat free artificial sweetened products this means no crystal light have at least 60 90 mins of outside free play including being active for that long not just blowing bubbles on the grass no sugar should be in toddler diet except for special occasions birthdays christmas etc it will take time for her to lose weight and as she grows taller she will also slim down bit as well because babies toddlers children grow in weight before they grow in height also skim milk should be
